channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harris breaks from ‘Bidenomics’ in North Carolina
item.description: The vice president makes her pitch in North Carolina, where Democrats have long hoped to flip the closely divided state.

item.title: How Russian Trolls Are Trying to Go Viral on X
item.description: A Kremlin-backed influence network sought engagement with Elon Musk, Donald Trump Jr. and other influential accounts.

item.title: The vibes and styles of the Democratic National Convention
item.description: DNC convention delegates showed up this week dressed for the moment, donning donkey-patterned jackets, labor union buttons and brat-green buttons.

item.title: Harris' economic plan supercharges Biden proposals to fight inflation
item.description: The vice president's plan aims to make housing more affordable, ease health care costs and crack down on corporations for rising grocery prices.

item.title: Second Patient in Trial for Elon Musk's Neuralink Uses Design Software, Videogames
item.description: The entrepreneur is in a race against rivals to wire the human brain.

item.title: The making of Kamala Harris, as told by her kindergarten best friend
item.description: Stacey Johnson-Batiste and her mother, Doris Johnson, reminisced about important moments in Harris’s childhood in Berkeley, Calif.

item.title: Everything was going Kamala Harris’ way. Then came the market sell-off.
item.description: "We cannot win if people think we’re headed into a recession," one Democratic National Committee member said.

item.title: Alibaba, Tencent Cast Wide Net for AI Upstarts
item.description: China’s internet giants are betting billions on incubating the country’s OpenAI challengers, with Alibaba Group and Tencent leading the charge.

item.title: The reinvention of Kamala Harris
item.description: Harris’s energized rallies mark a sharp contrast from her often-stumbling appearances of four years ago. That’s not an accident.

item.title: JD Vance at RNC: Trump is the working class' 'last, best hope'
AMD Buys AI Equipment Maker for Nearly $5 Billion, Escalating Battle With Nvidia
item.description: ZT Systems produces servers and other equipment used in data centers for artificial intelligence.

item.title: Toxic exes, saving childless ladies’ cats: Memorable lines from DNC Night 3
item.description: Bill Clinton described Donald Trump as a narcissist. Hakeem Jeffries compared him to a toxic ex. And Oprah Winfrey urged the crowd to “choose joy.”
